## Welcome
This is my personal site for the course *Introduction to Bioinformatics 22111*.  
I’m collecting my notes and exercises here as PDFs. They’re not meant to be perfect—just a record of my learning and a way to consolidate the material. Although this course is quite basic.
:::

::: {.panel .syllabus}
## Syllabus (overview)

**Biological databases**  
: Taxonomy, GenBank, UniProt; navigating sequence repositories; converting between nucleotide and protein data.

**DNA → protein translation**  
: Codon usage; translating DNA into protein; annotation basics.

**Pairwise alignment & BLAST**  
: Global vs. local alignment; scoring matrices; BLAST search strategies; interpreting results.

**Protein structures**  
: Protein Data Bank (PDB); molecular visualization with PyMOL; analyzing 3D protein architecture.

**Sequence logos & information content**  
: Representing conservation graphically; entropy and information theory in sequence analysis.

**Case study: malaria vaccine**  
: Applying bioinformatics to immunology and vaccine design.

**Weight matrices & prediction methods**  
: Position weight matrices (PWMs); motif detection; iterative searches with PSI-BLAST.

**Multiple sequence alignment & phylogeny**  
: Algorithms for aligning many sequences; evolutionary models; constructing and interpreting phylogenetic trees.
:::
